Authors: Fabian A Michelangeli, Carmen Ulloa Ulloa, Karla Sosa
Title:
Quipuanthus, a new genus and species of Melastomataceae from
the foothills of the Andes in Ecuador and Peru
Abstract:
The new genus Quipuanthus from the foothills of the
eastern Andes of Ecuador and Peru is described. Quipuanthus seems to be
related to Allomaieta Gleason, Alloneuron Pilger, and Wurdastom
Walln√∂fer in the tribe Cyphostyleae, but the combination of characters
as an herb with haplostemonous flowers, recurved style, inferior ovary
and apically dehiscent capsular fruits are unique among the
Melastomataceae. The new species Quipuanthus epipetricus Michelan. &
C. Ulloa is described and illustrated.
